Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 87 runs, guiding India to a decent total on a slow surface.
Mohammed Shami took 4 wickets for 22 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah took 3 wickets for 32 runs.
India restricted England to 229/9 in their 50 overs.
England's batting line-up disintegrated under pressure, losing all ten wickets for just 99 runs.
India's sixth consecutive win sends them top of the table, two points clear of South Africa in second.
Chris Woakes dismissed Shubman Gill and Virat Kohli early in the innings.
David Willey accounted for Virat Kohli, KL Rahul, and Suryakumar Yadav.
Jasprit Bumrah's double strike removed Dawid Malan and Joe Root.
Mohammed Shami bowled 10 balls to Ben Stokes before dismissing him.
Kuldeep Yadav removed Jos Buttler for ten runs.
Kuldeep Yadav trapped Liam Livingstone lbw.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami ripped through the England top-order in Lucknow.
India's win leaves England rooted to the bottom of the standings.
India's unchanged team took off at the back of Rohit Sharma's aggressive charge.
England's spin-bowling all-rounders tried to rebuild but were undone by India's bowlers.
